data.title: Babcock & Wilcox to host Q3 2025 conference call on Nov 10 at 5pm ET. AKRON, Ohio--(BUSINESS WIRE) $BW.
data.description: A conference call and webcast will be held by B&W in Akron, Ohio on Monday, November 10, 2025, starting at 5 p.m. Eastern Time.

data.title: Civeo Corp (NYSE:CVEO) announces Q3 2025 results, led by growth in Australia and cost reduction in Canada. CEO pleased with progress.
data.description: In Houston, Civeo Corporation (NYSE:CVEO) released its financial and operational performance for the third quarter ending on September 30, 2025. Bradley J. Dodson, the President and CEO of Civeo, highlighted the company's accomplishments, noting growth in Australia and enhanced cost efficiency in Canada. The Australian segment demonstrated growth compared to both the previous year and the previous quarter. Civeo's positive third-quarter outcomes reflect successful operational and strategic initiatives.

The number of victims in the mass traffic accident in Tula has increased to 22, 6 of them are in serious condition, said the regional health minister Sergey Mukhin.

data.title: Butterfly Network (BFLY) releases Q3 2025 results; highlights portable ultrasound tech. CEO Joseph DeVivo optimistic.
data.description: In Burlington, Massachusetts and New York, Butterfly Network, Inc. (NYSE: BFLY) shared financial results for the third quarter ending September 30, 2025. The company specializes in portable ultrasound technology and software for healthcare. Joseph DeVivo, President, CEO, and Chairman of Butterfly, highlighted the quarter as a time of essential advancement.

data.title: Apogee Enterprises CEO, Ty R. Silberhorn, to step down on October 31, 2025. Donald A. Nolan appointed as new CEO.
data.description: Apogee Enterprises, Inc. has revealed that their Independent Chair, Donald A. Nolan, will take over as the new Chief Executive Officer, starting on October 31, 2025. This change comes as the current CEO, Ty R. Silberhorn, steps down from his position and the Board on the same date. With this appointment, Mr. Nolan will also assume the role of Executive Chair of the Board. This transition marks a significant change within the company, listed on Nasdaq as APOG.

data.title: GEMS Education and Infinity Developments consider opening new international school in Zanzibar, Tanzania.
data.description: Education company GEMS Education and real estate developer Infinity Developments are in discussions to create a new international school in Zanzibar. The school aims to provide quality education to students in the region. Zanzibar, known for its rich cultural heritage and stunning beaches, could benefit from this initiative with the potential to cater to a large number of students. The collaboration between GEMS Education and Infinity Developments highlights the growing interest in expanding educational opportunities in the area.

data.title: Xenia Hotels & Resorts reported Q3 2025: Net loss $13.7M, Adjusted EBITDAre $42.2M; YTD 2025 highlights: Net income $57M, Adjusted FFO $1.31 per share. Total liquidity $688M and total outstanding debt $1.4B as of September 30, 2025. The company repurchased shares of common stock totaling $83.8M in 2025. Dividends declared at $0.14 per share for Q3, $59-67M projected net income for full 2025. Market impact and outlook discussed.
data.description: Xenia Hotels & Resorts reported their financial results for the third quarter of 2025. They announced a net loss of $13.7 million, with Adjusted EBITDAre at $42.2 million (a 4.6% decrease from 2024), and Adjusted FFO per Diluted Share at $0.23 (an 8.0% decrease from 2024). Same-Property Occupancy was at 66.3%, ADR was $248.09, RevPAR was $164.50, and Total RevPAR was $289.76. Their Year-to-Date 2025 highlights included a net income of $57.0 million, Adjusted EBITDAre of $194.7 million (a 9.4% increase from 2024), and Adjusted FFO per Diluted Share of $1.31 (a 9.2% increase from 2024). They made significant capital market activities during the year and declared a third-quarter dividend of $0.14 per share. Marcel Verbaas, the CEO, commented on the challenges faced by the lodging industry and their outlook for 2026. The Company had total outstanding debt of approximately $1.4 billion and a total liquidity of approximately $688 million as of September 30, 2025. Amidst many improvements and renovations at several properties, Xenia Hotels & Resorts is cautiously optimistic about their future growth prospects. Operating results include specifics on revenues, expenses, and financial statements, with additional information provided on their liquidity, balance sheet, capital market activities, and future outlook and guidance.

data.title: Agriculture biotechnology market to reach $144.25B by 2030, growing at 9.4% CAGR from $92.19B in 2025 -Report.
data.description: A recent report from MarketsandMarketsâ„¢ reveals that the agriculture biotechnology market is expected to see significant growth in the coming years. Starting at USD 92.19 billion in 2025, it is projected to reach USD 144.25 billion by 2030, with a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 9.4%. This market is experiencing rapid expansion globally, showcasing the increasing importance and adoption of biotechnology in the agricultural sector.

data.title: Lear Corp (NYSE: LEA) reported Q3 2025 revenue of $5.7 billion, a significant achievement in automotive technology sector.
data.description: Headquartered in Southfield, Michigan, Lear Corporation (NYSE: LEA), a prominent figure in automotive technology focused on Seating and E-Systems, announced its financial results for the third quarter of 2025. One of the key highlights during this period was achieving a revenue of $5.7 billion.

data.title: OneMain Holdings reports impressive 3Q 2025 results - Diluted EPS $1.67, C&I adjusted diluted EPS $1.90, managed receivables $25.9B. Dividend raised by 1% to $1.05/share and approved $1.0B share repurchase program.
data.description: In the third quarter of 2025, the Diluted Earnings Per Share (EPS) was reported at $1.67, while the Commercial and Industrial (C&I) adjusted Diluted EPS stood at $1.90. Managed receivables for the same period amounted to $25.9 billion. Additionally, there was a 1% increase in the quarterly dividend, which now stands at $1.05 per share. The Board of Directors has also sanctioned a $1.0 billion share repurchase initiative. This information was disclosed out of New York on October 31, 2025.

data.title: Chevron Q3 2025 earnings: $3.5B ($1.82/share), down from $4.5B ($2.48/share) in Q3 2024. Hess acquisition costs and forex impact noted.
data.description: In the third quarter of 2025, Chevron Corporation (NYSE: CVX) announced earnings of $3.5 billion, equivalent to $1.82 per share on a diluted basis. This is a decrease from the third quarter of 2024 when earnings were reported at $4.5 billion, or $2.48 per diluted share. The earnings for the current quarter were impacted by a net loss of $235 million, attributed to severance and transaction costs due to the acquisition of Hess Corporation (Hess). However, this was partly offset by the fair value measurement of Hess shares. Foreign currency fluctuations also played a role, contributing to an increase in earnings by $147 million.

data.title: Weekly recap of 12 consumer press releases this week, including Pizza Hut's "Hallo-WINGS" and Dove's Radio City Rockettes partnership.
data.description: This week, PR Newswire covers major updates in consumer and retail sectors. Pizza Hut introduces "Hallo-WINGS", Dove collaborates with Radio City Rockettes for holiday campaign, and Lemme Purr launches a new probiotic lollipop. These announcements come from New York, with the information released on October 31, 2025. Stay up to date with the latest developments in the consumer and retail industries.
